.. _biconditional_elimination_1_math_concept:

.. role:: python(code)
    :language: py

.. tags:: biconditional-elimination-1, math, concept, inference-rule

biconditional-elimination-1 (math concept)
=============================================

.. seealso::
   :ref:`python declaration class<biconditional_elimination_1_declaration_python_class>` | :ref:`python inclusion class<biconditional_elimination_1_inclusion_python_class>` | :ref:`python sample<biconditional_elimination_1_python_sample>`

Definition
----------

*biconditional-elimination-1* is the following :ref:`inference-rule<inference_rule_math_concept>`:

.. math::

   \left( P \iff Q \right) \vdash \left( P \implies Q \right)

Where:

* :math:`P \iff Q` is a :ref:`formula-statement`
* :math:`P` is a propositional :ref:`formula`
* :math:`Q` is a propositional :ref:`formula`

In straightforward language, if P is true if and only if Q is true, it follows that P implies Q.
